meanings.definition: Outwrought (verb): past tense of outwork, to work harder or more skillfully than someone else
meanings.sent1: She outwrought her competition by practicing every day.
meanings.sent2: He outwrought his colleagues with his dedication to the project.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outwrought the other animals in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outwrought any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The student outwrought his classmates in the math competition with his quick thinking.

meanings.definition: Outwrought (adjective): worked out or completed in a thorough or detailed manner
meanings.sent1: The outwrought plan left no room for errors.
meanings.sent2: The outwrought puzzle took hours to complete.
meanings.sent3: The outwrought schedule ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent4: Her outwrought painting captured every detail perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The outwrought report impressed the entire team with its thoroughness.
